alert.note: Alert for Bexar; Blanco; Comal; Guadalupe; Hays; Kendall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 05 at 5:07AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Hays, northwestern Guadalupe, southeastern Blanco, southeastern Kendall, northwestern Bexar and Comal Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 507 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Johnson City to Guadalupe River State Park to Fair Oaks Ranch. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... San Antonio, New Braunfels, San Marcos, Schertz, Kyle, Cibolo, Universal City, Live Oak, Buda, Selma, Dripping Springs, Wimberley, Blanco, Canyon Lake Dam, Randolph AFB, Canyon Lake, Fair Oaks Ranch, Bulverde, Garden Ridge, and Hollywood Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bexar; Blanco; Comal; Guadalupe; Hays; Kendall
